articles.title: Mongolian President Voices Support for Korea's Peaceful Reunification
articles.content:
Mongolian President Voices Support for Korea's Peaceful Reunification
Pyongyang, February 25 (KCNA) -- Ri  Su Yong, foreign minister of the DPRK on a visit to Mongolia, met and had a talk with  Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj, president of Mongolia, on Feb. 24.
					 The president said he would make active efforts to contribute to Korea's peaceful reunification, adding the Mongolian government will maintain its consistent stand in regional and international arenas that Korea has to be reunified in a peaceful way.
					
					 He said that Marshal Kim Jong Un is paying deep attention to developing the long-standing bilateral relations provided by President Kim Il Sung and the preceding leaders of Mongolia onto a new higher stage.
					
					 Ri Su Yong also met and had a talk with Mongolian Prime Minister Chimedin Saykhanbileg on the same day.

articles.title: Greetings to Kuwaiti Emir
articles.content:
Greetings to Kuwaiti Emir
Pyongyang, February 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greeting to Sabah Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah, emir of the State of Kuwait, on Wednesday on the occasion of the 54th anniversary of its independence and the 24th anniversary of its liberation.
					 The message expressed belief that the good, friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger and wished the emir and people of Kuwait bigger successes in their work for the development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Greetings to Kuwaiti PM
articles.content:
Greetings to Kuwaiti PM
Pyongyang, February 25 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju sent his greetings to Kuwaiti Prime Minister Jaber Al Mubarak Al Hamad Al Sabah on Feb. 25 on the occasions of the 54th anniversary of independence of Kuwait and the 24th anniversary of its liberation.
					 The message expressed belief that the bilateral friendly and cooperative relations would steadily grow stronger, wishing the prime minister and government of Kuwait greater success in their work for the economic development and prosperity of the country and the wellbeing of the people.

articles.title: Congratulations to President of Greece
articles.content:
Congratulations to President of Greece
Pyongyang, February 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on Feb. 19 sent a congratulatory message to Prokopis Pavlopoulos upon his election as president of the Republic of Greece.
					 The message expressed belief that the relations between the two countries would develop in the mutual interests and wished the president success in his work for the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: National Memorial Meeting Held to Mark Anniversary of Death of Revolutionary Martyr O Jin U
articles.content:
National Memorial Meeting Held to Mark Anniversary of Death of Revolutionary Martyr O Jin U
Pyongyang, February 25 (KCNA) -- A national memorial meeting took place at the Central Youth Hall Wednesday to mark the 20th anniversary of death of revolutionary martyr O Jin U. 
					 O Jin U, a revolutionary soldier loyal to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and prominent activist of the party, state and army, was born on March 8, 1917 and died on February 25, 1995. He grew up to be a revolutionary under the care of the peerlessly great persons of Mt. Paektu and performed distinguished feats in the two revolutionary wars against the Japanese and U.S. imperialists and in the building of revolutionary armed forces and socialist construction.
					
					 He upheld the party and the leader and led a shining life with one image, bearing the immutable revolutionary faith. He made distinguished contribution to settling the issue of the succession of leadership decisive of the destiny of the party and the revolution.
					
					 Present at the meeting were Choe Ryong Hae, Hyon Yong Chol, Ri Yong Mu, Vice-Premier Kim Yong Jin, officials of the party, armed forces, ministries and national institutions, service personnel of the Korean People's Army, persons of distinguished services, bereaved families of revolutionary martyrs, officials of institutions and industrial establishments and labor innovators in Pyongyang.
					
					 Army General Hyon Yong Chol, minister of the People's Armed Forces, said in his memorial address:
					
					 O Jin U enjoyed the greatest honor and worthwhile life as a revolutionary soldier thanks to the particular trust and love of the President and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Though he passed away, the strong revolutionary spirit displayed by him and the immortal feats performed by him in upholding the Songun revolutionary cause of Juche in the van with white gem-like loyalty will dynamically encourage the party, the army and the people in their struggle for defending the country and accelerating the final victory of building a thriving nation and always go down in the history of the country.
					
					 It is the noble duty and moral obligation of the service personnel and people, descendants of the President and soldiers and disciples of Kim Jong Il to follow the revolutionary spirit of Paektu, the spirit of the blizzards of Paektu displayed by the anti-Japanese revolutionary forerunners and remain true to the Songun revolutionary leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The speaker calls upon all party members, service personnel and people to uphold the New Year address made by Kim Jong Un, the resolution of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and the joint slogans of the Central Committee and the Central Military Commission of the WPK, turn out in the general offensive for the dignity and prosperity of the country and thus bring about a new turn in the building of a thriving nation this year.

articles.title: Wreaths Laid before Bust of O Jin U
articles.content:
Wreaths Laid before Bust of O Jin U
Pyongyang, February 25 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were laid before the bust of revolutionary martyr O Jin U at the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong on Wednesday, the 20th anniversary of his death.
					 Seen standing before the bust was a wreath sent by Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremony were Choe Ryong Hae, Hyon Yong Chol, Vice-Premier Kim Yong Jin, officials of the party, armed forces and power bodies, service personnel of the Korean People's Army, bereaved family members and working people in Pyongyang.
					
					 Placed before the bust were wreaths in the name of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces, ministries and national institutions and party and power bodies and universities in the city.
					
					 The participants observed a moment's silence in memory of O Jin U who remained unfailingly loyal to the party and the leader, the country and its people and took the lead in upholding the Songun revolutionary cause of Juche till the last moments of his life with white gem-like loyalty.

articles.title: Preparations for Spring Tree Planting Brisk in DPRK
articles.content:
Preparations for Spring Tree Planting Brisk in DPRK
Pyongyang, February 25 (KCNA) -- Preparations for spring tree planting have got into full swing at tree nurseries and forestry management stations in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 The Hamhung City Tree Nursery has cultivated hundreds of thousands of saplings, while paying efforts to increasing the species of saplings. It supplied more than 700 000 saplings to various establishments in the city.
					
					 The Wonsan City Forestry Management Station cultivated more than 1.2 million saplings of 10 species.
					
					 The Thaechon County Forestry Management Station put the sapling cultivation on a scientific basis, thus turning out more than two millions of saplings. The county set it a goal to build one thousand hectares of forest in this spring.
					
					 Preparations for spring tree planting have entered final stage at tree nurseries in North Phyongan, Kangwon and North Hwanghae provinces.

articles.title: Opera "The Tale of Chun Hyang" Re-created in DPRK
articles.content:
Opera "The Tale of Chun Hyang" Re-created in DPRK
Pyongyang, February 25 (KCNA) -- The national opera "The Tale of Chun Hyang" has been re-created by the Phibada Opera Troupe in the DPRK to suit the aesthetic sense of the times. The opera, adapted from a classical work, was created in the 1960s. 
					 Its performance began at the Pyongyang Grand Theatre to celebrate the Lunar New Year's Day. 
					
					 The opera, based on a love story of Song Chun Hyang and Ri Mong Ryong, lively represents the noble emotion and lofty ethics of the Korean nation, desirous of justice against the feudal status system.
					
					 It has prologue, epilogue and 10 scenes.
					
					 The performance of the recreated opera is now arousing deep interest from among people for skilful combination of stanzaed songs, Korean-style orchestra, folk dances and stage decor.

articles.title: DPRK Scholar Terms U.S. Kingpin of Human Rights Abuses
articles.content:
DPRK Scholar Terms U.S. Kingpin of Human Rights Abuses
Pyongyang, February 25 (KCNA) -- The U.S., riddled with all sorts of social evils, is the kingpin of human rights abuses in the world, said Ri Song Il, a researcher of the International Affairs Institute of the DPRK. 
					 Referring to the fact that the U.S. recently called a "conference on human rights" as part of its anti-DPRK campaign over the human rights issue, he told KCNA:
					
					 The anti-DPRK human rights racket by the U.S. in international arena had already been rejected as it was based on the false "testimonies" of some defectors and aimed to topple the social system of the DPRK.
					
					 This empire of evil has now come under the world public criticism for its poor human rights records, with Ferguson case, maltreatment against the inmates and other cases as an occasion.
					
					 Some days ago, the director of the U.S. Federal Bureau of Investigation in a speech at Georgetown University acknowledged the existence of serious racial problems in the U.S., and political parties of Egypt issued a statement urging the United Nations to stop the U.S. human rights violations.
					
					 The U.S. is well advised to mind its own business before pulling up others.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Slams U.S. Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Farce
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Slams U.S. Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Farce
Pyongyang, February 25 (KCNA) -- Another round of the "seminar on human rights" in the north took place in Washington on Feb. 17.
					 The seminar sponsored by CSIS discussed the adoption of a "new resolution on the north" under the pretence of the first anniversary of the release of a "report of the UN Commission of Inquiry" on human rights situation in the DPRK. 
					
					 It brought together former and incumbent officials of the U.S. Department of State and Congress including the special envoy of the Department of State for the north's human rights, the former chairman and the special rapporteur of the Commission of Inquiry on human rights situation in the DPRK. They repeated lies and fabrications malignantly slandering the DPRK.
					
					 Last year the U.S. convened "a high-level meeting concerning human rights situation in north Korea" and made the "report of the Commission of Inquiry" and "human rights resolution" of the UN General Assembly be adopted on the basis of "testimonies" peppered with lies and fabrications let loose by "defectors from the north".
					
					 The international community expressed support and sympathy with the just stand of the DPRK which categorically rejected the "human rights resolution" the U.S. and its followers railroaded through the UN and declared its toughest counteraction to foil it.
					
					 Nevertheless, the U.S. sponsored another seminar on the theme of "how to keep alive the opportunities for the discussion of human rights situation in the north." This is aimed at adopting a new "resolution on human rights in the north" at the UN Human Rights Council meeting slated in Geneva in coming March and intensifying  anti-DPRK "human rights" racket by taking it as its long-term strategy to politicize and internationalize the DPRK's "human rights issue".
					
					 This is evidenced by the utterances made by Darusman, special rapporteur, that it was necessary to make multilateral access to the "human rights issue" as is the case with the nuclear issue.
					
					 The U.S.-led "human rights" smear campaign designed to topple the man-centered socialist system which the people of the DPRK value dearer than their own lives is the most vivid expression of the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. and its followers are making desperate efforts to politicize and internationalize the non-existent "human rights issue" of the DPRK to bring down the socialist system.
					
					 It is ridiculous, indeed, for the U.S. to stage such a cheap "human rights seminar" aimed to destabilize the DPRK through political and military stand-off.
					
					 The ceaseless despicable "human rights" rackets of the U.S. and its allies are being shattered to pieces in the face of the towering indignation and the will of the army and people of the DPRK to annihilate the enemies.
					
					 The U.S. and other hostile forces would be well advised to immediately stop their reckless "human rights" campaign.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Opening Up Broad Avenue to Independent Reunification
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Opening Up Broad Avenue to Independent Reunification
Pyongyang, February 25 (KCNA) -- A resolution of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and the joint slogans of the Central Committee and the Central Military Commission of the WPK which were made public on the occasion of the 70th anniversaries of the founding of the WPK and Korea's liberation serve as an invincible banner giving strong spurs to the triumphant advance of the movement for national reunification, says Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in an article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The resolution and joint slogans call on all Koreans in the north, the south and abroad to resolutely foil the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet group's moves for a war against the north, their anti-DPRK nuclear racket and "human rights" ruckus and open up a broad avenue to independent reunification, united close under the banner of patriotism and in the idea of By Our Nation Itself.
					
					 It is a prerequisite to opening up a broad avenue to independent reunification to foil their moves to escalate the confrontation with the DPRK.
					
					 Peace can neither settle on the Korean peninsula nor the inter-Korean relations get rid of the mire of catastrophe if the U.S. is allowed to seek to ignite a nuclear war utterly indifferent to the destiny of the Korean nation and the puppet group is allowed to escalate the confrontation with the DPRK, pursuant to the U.S. policy. 
					
					 This is a lesson drawn by the Korean nation last year and a hard reality of the inter-Korean relations.
					
					 It is an important task for preserving the dignity and sovereignty of the nation and mending the inter-Korean relations to put an end to the U.S. imperialists and the puppet group's nuclear racket against the DPRK and "human rights" ruckus.
					
					 The article calls upon all the Koreans to get united close under the banner of patriotism and in the idea of By Our Nation Itself and open up a broad avenue to independent reunification.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Raps at Japan for Its Moves to Cover Its Past Crimes
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Raps at Japan for Its Moves to Cover Its Past Crimes
Pyongyang, February 25 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, nineteen American historians issued a statement in denunciation of the Japanese authorities' moves to distort history. They in their statement disclosed in detail the Japanese government's improper intention to rewrite the pages of the U.S. textbooks dealing with the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army. But elites of the Japanese political circle are letting loose a string of remarks that "inappropriate expressions" are used in the U.S. textbooks and Japan demanded the U.S. rewrite them as they are contrary to facts.
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes in a commentary in this regard: 
					
					 What they uttered is, indeed, shameless jargon which can be let loose only by guys with bearskin.
					
					 With no rhetoric can Japan deny that what the Japanese imperialists committed was hideous ones against humanity. The world community is simmering with rage over the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army and regards Japan with disgust because coercion was involved in drafting women as sexual slaves and it was the most brutal crime committed against humanity.
					
					 Japan's purpose of denying the sexual slavery is designed to keep its crimes against humanity buried into oblivion in a bid to evade the settlement of its past crimes.
					
					 It is an unavoidable legal obligation of Japan to redeem its crimes under any circumstances.
					
					 Japan should honestly admit its crimes, though belatedly, and opt for settling its past wrongs.
					
					 This would do Japan good either.

articles.title: Minju Joson Raps at Projected U.S.-S. Korea Nuclear War Exercises against DPRK
articles.content:
Minju Joson Raps at Projected U.S.-S. Korea Nuclear War Exercises against DPRK
Pyongyang, February 25 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, the U.S. announced that about 8,200 U.S. forces, 3,000 more than last year, would be involved in Key Resolve joint military drill this year and a newly introduced combat warship would be involved in Foal Eagle. 
					 Minju Joson Wednesday in a commentary terms Key Resolve and Foal Eagle typical nuclear war exercises to mount a sudden and preemptive strike at the DPRK.
					
					 It is the first time that some 8,200 U.S. forces will be involved in Key Resolve, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 This proves that the U.S. is pushing forward the preparations for a nuclear war against the DPRK in real earnest after making it a fait accompli.
					
					 The above-said scenario of the U.S. is touching off bitter resentment among the service personnel and people of the DPRK all out in the showdown with the former.
					
					 The present situation goes to prove that all the service personnel and people of the DPRK were very right when they turned out in the unprecedented confrontation with the U.S., the sworn enemy, so as to force it to meet its final doom in its mainland.
					
					 Ridiculous, indeed, is for the south Korean puppet group to zealously join the U.S. in its moves to stifle the DPRK, not aware of its final destruction.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will let the warmongers experience what a war is like as they are keen to unleash a nuclear war against it. Regret would come late when the puppet group will not be able to escape doom together with its U.S. master.

articles.title: S. Korean Chief Executive Accused of Escalating Confrontation with North
articles.content:
S. Korean Chief Executive Accused of Escalating Confrontation with North
Pyongyang, February 25 (KCNA) -- A commentary accusing the south Korean chief executive of persisting in confrontation with the north was posted by Jaju Minbo, an internet paper of south Korea, on Feb. 17.
					 The chief executive is persisting in the policy for stifling the north and such stand was expressed at the meeting of the "preparatory committee for unification", the commentary said.
					
					 The meeting proved once again that what she talked about dialogue and unification is entirely aimed at escalating confrontation and anti-reunification acts, it charged.
					
					 The orientation to be maintained by her in dialogue with the north is the denuclearization of the north, the top priority policy of the U.S., and to this end she is showing her consistency, it deplored.

articles.title: S. Korean Body Accuses Management Side of Maltreating Workers
articles.content:
S. Korean Body Accuses Management Side of Maltreating Workers
Pyongyang, February 25 (KCNA) -- The Kumho trade union of south Korea held a press conference in Kwangju on Feb. 21 denouncing the management side for maltreating workers, according to an internet paper of south Korea.
					 A worker of a factory in Koksong, South Jolla Province died on Feb. 16 due to inhuman maltreatment by the management side.
					
					 At the press conference speakers described his death as a natural product of the conversion of regular job into part-time one and the piecework system.
					
					 The workers opposed the system but the management side threatened a disciplinary action, they charged.
					
					 They declared they would stage a sit-in strike inside tents in protest against the maltreatment of workers.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised by German Body, Belarusian Political Party
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised by German Body, Belarusian Political Party
Pyongyang, February 25 (KCNA) -- A German organization and a Belarusian political party posted special write-ups on their websites on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					 The Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany posted a portrait depicting his smiling image with an article titled "Kim Jong Il, son of guerillas" on Feb. 16.
					
					 The article said that Kim Jong Il, who was born as the son of the guerillas on Mt. Paektu on Feb. 16, 1942, grew up, hearing the gun reports of the anti-Japanese war. He was possessed of strong will, courage and pluck as befitting a brilliant commander, it noted, and went on:
					
					 His was a brilliant life of the great revolutionary who performed undying exploits for the Korean revolution and the cause of human independence while conducting energetic revolutionary activities as the guerillas did.
					
					 He, who devoted his all to the country and people, is remembered as the eternal image of the great Paektusan nation and son of the guerillas by the Korean people.
					
					 On Feb. 13 the Forum posted an article titled "To V. I. Lenin, Kim Jong Il" which said he laid a wreath before the Lenin Mausoleum and paid silent tribute during his visit to Russia, arousing big public sensation of the world media.
					
					 A district committee of Vitebsk City of the Communist Party of Belarus posted articles praising his undying exploits and noble traits under the titles of "Admiration of world politicians for Comrade Kim Jong Il", "Great patriot" and "Life devoted to future" on Feb. 16.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised by Foreign Personages
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised by Foreign Personages
Pyongyang, February 25 (KCNA) -- Receptions, book and photo exhibitions and film shows took place at DPRK embassies in different countries and the DPRK permanent mission in the UN Office and international bodies in Geneva on Feb. 12 and 13 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Displayed at the venues of the events were photos documenting the immortal exploits of President Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also on display there were works of the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu and books and photos introducing Songun Korea.
					
					 Films shown included Korean film "Pyongyang Built on Debris of War."
					
					 The vice-chairman of the Commission for External Affairs of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Vietnam said that General Secretary Kim Jong Il further developed the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two parties and the two countries provided by President Ho Chi Minh and President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The secretary general of the Malaysia-DPRK Friendship Association noted that Kim Jong Il pursued the original Songun politics to turn the DPRK into a military power no formidable enemy dares to provoke.
					
					 The chairman of the Youth Movement of Pakistan praised Kim Jong Il as the great leader not only of the Korean people but also of the progressives and peerlessly brilliant commander who foiled the U.S. vicious moves to stifle the DPRK and turned it into an invincible power.
					
					 The chairman of the Supreme Council of the Socialist Party of Romania and other speakers stressed that Kim Jong Il's unique party-building exploits serve as a valuable treasure to be cherished by all progressive parties.
					
					 The general secretary of the Guinea People's Assembly said Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il rendered disinterested support to the Guinean people in their struggle for creating a new life.
					
					 The secretary general of the Inter-Parliamentary Union noted that the DPRK has remained strong thanks to the outstanding and tested leadership of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Guinean Media Praise Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Guinean Media Praise Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, February 25 (KCNA) -- Guinean media dedicated special write-ups to the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The Guinean paper Horoya on Feb. 11 dedicated a whole page to an article titled "Life devoted to future" with his photo.
					
					 The paper said that Kim Jong Il devoted his all to bringing prosperous future to the DPRK true to the intention of President Kim Il Sung. It went on:
					
					 For the future! This was the patriotic spirit that ran through his whole life.
					
					 He found his life goal and worth in working heart and soul for a thriving nation and people's happiness.
					
					 His bright image will shine long not only in the hearts of the Korean people but progressive humankind.
					
					 The Guinean Domestic, International and Seven National Languages Broadcasting Services on Feb. 9 aired how Kimjongilia came into being in the world and that it won gold and top prizes at the international flower expos and shows and the flowers of the sun have been in full bloom across the world, being loved and admired by humankind.
					
					 The services introduced in detail the life of Kim Jong Il devoted to the future on Feb. 13.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Posted by Nigerian Organization on Its Website
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Posted by Nigerian Organization on Its Website
Pyongyang, February 25 (KCNA) -- Marshal Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Brilliantly Accomplish the Revolutionary Cause of Juche, Holding Kim Jong Il in High Esteem as the Eternal General Secretary of Our Party" was posted by the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism on its website on Feb. 16.
					 The work, published on April 6, Juche 101 (2012), says that it is the principled requirement for victoriously advancing the revolutionary cause in the DPRK to hold leader Kim Jong Il in high esteem as the eternal general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					
					 It indicates tasks to be fulfilled to steadily develop the WPK into the glorious party of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Seminars Held in Sri Lanka, Sweden
articles.content:
Seminars Held in Sri Lanka, Sweden
Pyongyang, February 25 (KCNA) -- There took place seminars in Sri Lanka and Sweden on Feb. 13 and 14 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 W. A. Dumindwardane, chairman of the Study Society for Self-Reliance of Sri Lanka, addressed the seminar.
					
					 He said that Kim Jong Il bolstered up defense capability in every way through his energetic Songun leadership.
					
					 Under his leadership the Korean People's Army developed into an invincible army and combat ranks fully equipped with powerful offensive and defensive means capable of defeating any aggressors at a single blow, the chairman noted, and continued:
					
					 The DPRK turned into an impregnable fortress equipped with a nuclear deterrent.
					
					 Oskar Molleby, chief of the Swedish Group for the Study of the Juche Idea, said that Kim Jong Il was a peerlessly brilliant commander of Songun.
					
					 His feats are great, indeed, the chief said, and went on:
					
					 The DPRK is stepping up the building of a thriving socialist nation while frustrating every move of the imperialist allied forces to stifle it. This goes to prove the validity and vitality of the Songun politics enforced by Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The DPRK is greatly encouraging the world's progressives.
					
					 A congratulatory message to Marshal Kim Jong Un was adopted at the seminar held in Sweden.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente electo de Grecia
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente electo de Grecia
Pyongyang, 25 de febrero (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 19 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente electo de la Republica de Grecia, Prokopis Pavlopoulos.
					En la misiva, el remitente expreso la conviccion de que las relaciones entre ambos paises se desarrollaran conforme a los intereses mutuos y formulo votos por exitos en los trabajos del destinatario por la prosperidad del pais.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita a emir de Kuwait
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita a emir de Kuwait
Pyongyang, 25 de febrero (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam envio el dia 25 un mensaje de felicitacion al emir del Estado de Kuwait, Sheikh Sabah Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah, en ocasion del 54o aniversario de la independencia y el 24o aniversario de la liberacion de este pais asiatico.
					En la misiva, el remitente expreso la conviccion de que seguiran fortaleciendose las excelentes relaciones de amistad y cooperacion  existentes entre ambos paises y formulo votos por mayores exitos en la labor del destinatario y su pueblo por el desarrollo y la prosperidad del pais.

articles.title: Tiene lugar acto central por 20o aniversario de fallecimiento de O Jin U
articles.content:
Tiene lugar acto central por 20o aniversario de fallecimiento de O Jin U
Pyongyang, 25 de febrero (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 25 en la Casa Central de la Juventud el acto central en memoria de O Jin U por 20o aniversario de fallecimiento de este martir revolucionario (nacido el 8 de marzo de 1917 y fallecido el 25 de febrero de 1995).
					O Jin U, soldado fiel al Presidente Kim Il Sung y al Dirigente Kim Jong Il y renombrado activista del partido, el Estado y el ejercito, crecio como revolucionario en el regazo de los grandes hombres del monte Paektu y realizo considerables proezas en las dos guerras revolucionarias contra el imperialismo japones y el norteamericano, en la construccion de las fuerzas armadas revolucionarias y en la edificacion del socialismo.
					
					El apoyo siempre con fidelidad al partido y al lider conservando la inconmovible conviccion revolucionaria.
					
					Realizo un merito extraordinario en la solucion del problema de sucesion de la direccion que determina el destino del partido y la revolucion. 
					
					Al acto asistieron Choe Ryong Hae, Hyon Yong Chol, Ri Yong Mu, el vicepremier Kim Yong Jin y otros funcionarios del partido, las fuerzas armadas, ministerios y organos centrales, los oficiales y soldados del Ejercito Popular de Corea, los benemeritos, los familiares de martires revolucionarios, los funcionarios de organos, fabricas y empresas de esta capital, asi como los innovadores de trabajo.
					
					El discurso de la ocasion estuvo a cargo del general de ejercito de las fuerzas terrestres Hyon Yong Chol, ministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares.
					
					El orador recordo que la vida de O Jin U fue la del soldado revolucionario que vivio bajo la confianza especial del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					Aunque fallecio el martir, su indoblegable espiritu revolucionario y hazanas indelebles seran registrados para siempre en los anales de la patria estimulando la lucha del partido, el ejercito y el pueblo por defender la patria y adelantar la victoria final de la causa de construccion de un Estado prospero y poderoso, dijo.
					
					Exhorto a los oficiales y soldados del EPC a aprender el espiritu revolucionario de Paektu, el de viento cortante del Paektu de los martires revolucionarios antijaponeses para apoyar fielmente la direccion del Mariscal Kim Jong Un sobre la revolucion mediante el Songun.
					
					Esto es un noble deber y obligacion moral de los oficiales y soldados del EPC y los habitantes, descendientes del Presidente y soldados y discipulos del Dirigente, remarco.
					
					Llamo a todos los militantes del partido, los oficiales y soldados del EPC y el pueblo a levantarse en la ofensiva general para la dignidad y la prosperidad de la patria en pleno acato al Mensaje del Ano Nuevo del Mariscal, la resolucion del Buro Politico del CC del PTC y las consignas conjuntas del Comite Central y la Comision Militar Central del PTC para registrar en este ano nuevo viraje en la construccion de un Estado prospero.

articles.title: Rinden homenaje a O Jin U en ocasion de vigesimo aniversario de su deceso
articles.content:
Rinden homenaje a O Jin U en ocasion de vigesimo aniversario de su deceso
Pyongyang, 25 de febrero (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 20o aniversario del fallecimiento del martir revolucionario O Jin U, tuvo lugar una ceremonia de homenaje ante su busto en el Cementerio de Martires Revolucionarios en el Monte Taesong.
					Estaba colocada alli una ofrenda floral enviada por el Mariscal Kim Jong Un.
					
					En la ocasion participaron Choe Ryong Hae, Hyon Yong Chol, el vicepremier Kim Yong Jin, los funcionarios de los organismos del partido, las fuerzas armadas y el poder, los oficiales y soldados del EPC, los familiares del martir y trabajadores capitalinos.
					
					Fueron depositadas las ofrendas y ramos florales en nombre del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, el Ministerio de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares, ministerios y organos centrales e instituciones del partido y el poder y  universidades en esta capital.
					
					Los participantes guardaron un momento de silencio en memoria de O Jin U quien era fiel al partido y al lider, a la patria y al pueblo hasta el ultimo momento de su vida y apoyo al frente la autoctona causa revolucionaria del Songun.

articles.title: ACNC comenta el "seminario de DDHH" efectuado en Washington
articles.content:
ACNC comenta el "seminario de DDHH" efectuado en Washington
Pyongyang, 25 de febrero (ACNC) -- El pasado dia 17, EE.UU. volvio a abrir en Washington el "seminario de DDHH" en el Norte de Corea.
					En el foro auspiciado por el Centro Norteamericano para los Estudios Estrategicos e Internacionales (CSIS) fue debatida la aprobacion de "nuevo proyecto de resolucion contra el Norte de Corea" so pretexto del primer aniversario de publicacion del "informe del comite de investigacion" de la ONU sobre la situacion de DDHH de la RPDC. 
					
					En la ocasion participaron el "enviado especial de DDHH del Norte de Corea" y otras figuras retiradas y en activo del Departamento de Estado y el Congreso, de Estados Unidos, el ex presidente del "comite de investigacion" sobre la situacion de DDHH de la RPDC y el "relator especial" quienes calumniaron a la RPDC repitiendo los datos fraudulentos y desmentidos.
					
					En el ano pasado, EE.UU. organizo la "reunion de alto nivel sobre los DDHH del Norte de Corea" y controlo por detras para que se aprobaran el "informe del comite de investigacion" y la "resolucion de DDHH" de la Asamblea General de la ONU a base de los "testimonios" llenos de mentiras y calumnias de los "fugitivos norcoreanos".
					
					En aquel entonces, fue apoyada en escala internacional la posicion justa de la RPDC que declaro la entrada en la confrontacion intransigente para rechazar e invalidar dicha "resolucion de DDHH" que EE.UU. y sus satelites aprobaron por la fuerza abusando de la ONU.
					
					Sin embargo, el imperio organizo de nuevo el "seminario" dando enfoque en el tema de "como mantener la oportunidad de discutir los DDHH del Norte de Corea".
					
					Esto parte del objetivo de aprobar coercitivamente el "nuevo proyecto de resolucion de DDHH del Norte de Corea" en marzo que viene en el Consejo de DDHH de la ONU en Ginebra y recrudecer asi la "ofensiva de DDHH" contra la RPDC tomando como estrategia de largo alcance la politizacion e internacionalizacion del mismo tema.
					
					Lo comprueba el hecho de que "relator especial" Darusman dijo que se debe intentar el acercamiento multilateral al "problema de DDHH" al igual que el de armas nucleares.
					
					Hoy en dia, resulta la manifestacion mas coherente de la politica hostil anti-RPDC la campana de "DDHH" que patrocina EE.UU. con el proposito de derrumbar el regimen socialista centrado en las masas populares, optado por el pueblo coreano que lo aprecia mas que su vida.
					
					Es muy absurdo que EE.UU. recurriera al destenido "seminario de DDHH", encaminado a la "desintegracion interna", en la confrontacion politica y militar con la RPDC.
					
					Esa sucia campana se ve fracasada ante la firme voluntad de nuestro ejercito y pueblo de aniquilar a los enemigos.
					
					EE.UU. y sus satelites deben parar ahora mismo su imprudente campana de "DDHH" anti-RPDC.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun denuncia intencion de Japon de encubrir sus crimenes pasados
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun denuncia intencion de Japon de encubrir sus crimenes pasados
Pyongyang, 25 de febrero (ACNC) -- En una declaracion condenatoria a la tergiversacion de la historia de las autoridades japonesas, 19 historiadores de Estados Unidos revelaron detalladamente la conducta injusta del gobierno de Japon tendente a enmendar los contenidos de los manuales de EE.UU. que tratan los crimenes de esclavitud sexual cometidos en el pasado por  el viejo ejercito japones. 
					Pero, altos funcionarios politicos del pais isleno dicen que demandaron modificar los manuales de EE.UU. porque contienen "las expresiones no apropiadas con contenidos irreales".
					
					El diario Rodong Sinmun, en un comentario individual divulgado el dia 25, lo califica de una locura muy descarada y continua:
					
					No hubo ni una vez la actitud japonesa tan descarada como hoy dirigida a tergiversar los contenidos de manual historico de otros paises.
					
					La atrocidad de Japon es irrefutablemente el crimen antietico nunca visto en la historia  cometido con el metodo coercitivo y mas barbaro, razon por la cual la sociedad internacional trata con repugnancia a Japon.
					
					Japon niega persistentemente sus crimenes a fin de borrar su historia llena de crimenes antietico y evadir la responsabilidad de liquidar el pasado.
					
					Para Japon, la liquidacion del pasado es un deber legal a ser cumplida sincera e incondicionalmente.
					
					Japon tiene que reconocerlo aunque sea tarde y liquidar el pasado, lo que es la unica via para salvar a si mismo.
